title.native: この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！
title.romaji: Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo!
title.english: KONOSUBA -God's blessing on this wonderful world!

description:
Kazuma Satou decides that today is the day to get out of the house for a bit. Since he dies, pointlessly, it's clearly a bad choice. The goddess who greets him in the afterlife, however, offers him a chance to be reborn in a world not unlike that of a video game, and as a bonus she'll even throw in a cool item or power! Can't possibly be a bad choice, right? Except he arrives with no money at all, dead average skills, and his "bonus" isn't useful at all--since he picked the goddess, Aqua, herself. How are the two of them supposed to defeat the evil Devil King and live happily ever after? Well, for them, it probably starts with day laboring rather than adventuring. And it's only going to get more disappointing from there!

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Syukufuku wo!
Konosuba - As Bençãos de Deus Neste Mundo Maravilhoso
为美好的世界献上祝福！
ขอให้โชคดีมีชัยในโลกแฟนตาซี!

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Masochism
tags.description: Prominently features characters who get sexual pleasure from being hurt or controlled by others.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Dullahan
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a Dullahan, a creature from Irish Folklore with a head that can be detached from its main body.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Dungeon
tags.description: Prominently features a dungeon environment.

tags.name: Succubus
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a succubus, a creature in medieval folklore that typically uses their sexual prowess to trap and seduce people to feed off them.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mtocoda/)

He worked as a music composer for Capcom after graduating from the Kunitachi College of Music. He left the company in 2003 and founded Design Wave in 2007, and is still working as a composer for video games.  He is known for his work on the Devil May Cry and Monster Hunter series.
Kimura Kashiko is an editor working for Mad Box.

[Instagram](http://www.instagram.com/leonardosanthos) | [Twitter](http://www.twitter.com/leonardosanthos) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/leonardosanthos) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@FalaCritica) | [Twitch](http://www.twitch.tv/FalaCritica)

Leonardo Santhos is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, and streamer.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Blitzcrank, the Great Steam Golem / Kog'Maw, The Mouth of the Abyss / Vel'Koz, the Eye of the Void / Wukong, the Monkey King (League of Legends)
- Pierce Wheels (Ben 10: Alien Force)
- Peter "Pete" Devin / Master Carter (BONDiNG)
- Agent Bratcher (Outer Banks)
- Henrich Zemo / Baron Zemo (1st voice; The Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes)
- Soren (The Dragon Prince)
- Myst (Grand Chase: Dimensional Chaser)
- Spartan Jared Miller (Halo 4)
- Tetsuya Fukazawa (Ju-On: Origins)
- Kyd Miller (1st voice - 10th season; The X-Files)
- Onix (Gears of War: Judgement)
!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/JavoOlguin/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/javierallwin/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/JavierOlguinpage/)

**Javier Olguín Vega** is a Mexican voice actor. He is known for being the Latin American Spanish voice of Peter Parker / Spiderman in _The Amazing Spiderman_ movies, Jackson Stewart in _Hannah Montana_ and Carl in _Phineas and Ferb_.
He is the recurring dub voice of Andrew Garfield.
**Houjou Makoto (北條真)** is a Japanese producer and animation planner.
Michiyoshi Minamisawa is a sound producer and the representative director of 81 Produce.
